item.title: Castle Vale pool
item.description:
Invitation to Tender: Castle Pool Infrastructure Upgrade Works
Castle Pool, located in Castle Vale, Birmingham, is inviting qualified contractors to submit tenders for a package of capital improvement works to enhance the facility's efficiency, accessibility and user experience. Castle Pool is a well-used community swimming facility serving residents, schools and local organisations. These works are essential to ensure the long-term sustainability of the pool and to maintain it as a valued community asset.
Scope of Works
The works to be delivered under this tender include:
•	Replacement of the existing air handling unit to improve ventilation, reduce energy usage and regulate humidity levels.
•	Installation of modern LED lighting throughout the building to improve energy efficiency, lighting quality and safety.
•	Refurbishment of poolside and changing area showers, including installation of modern, water-efficient units and associated fixtures.
Contractors are encouraged to propose cost-effective, durable and energy-efficient solutions. All works must be delivered with minimal disruption to ongoing operations.
Contractor Requirements
Bidders must demonstrate:
•	Relevant experience delivering comparable mechanical, electrical and building refurbishment works
•	Appropriate qualifications, certifications and professional accreditations
•	Capacity to complete works within agreed timescales
•	Evidence of public liability insurance and compliance with health and safety regulations
Site visits are available by appointment.
Submission Details
Interested contractors should submit:
•	A detailed proposal outlining approach, methodology and programme
•	Itemised costings
•	Evidence of relevant experience and qualifications
•	References from recent similar projects
Tenders must be submitted by email to:
Jane Roche - Operations Manager Spitfire Advice and Support Services ltd 
Email: janeroche@castlevale.org.uk
For an informal conversation about this opportunity, please call 0121 747 5932.
Closing Date
All tenders must be received by the stated deadline. Late submissions will not be considered.
This is a significant opportunity to support the improvement of a key community wellbeing resource. We welcome proposals from competent and experienced contractors capable of delivering high-quality, efficient and value-for-money outcomes.

item.title: NEPRO3 - Innovation Accelerator Design & Delivery - Knife  Crime Prevention
item.description:
College of Policing (COP) needs the supplier to run a 5-to-7-month innovation accelerator, including a 1-2-month start-up 
phase. The overarching aim of the accelerator is to enable cross-sector collaboration and explore the 
feasibility of solutions aimed at prevention knife crime. The Accelerator can be run in between 1 to 5 different locations across England and Wales. The College is open to suggestion to the feasibility of running the accelerator in multiple sites simultaneously and what the optimal number of locations would be 
given the timeframe and resources available.
Successful delivery of activities set out in the above section will depend on:
• Working closely with the Behavioural Science team and researchers to ensure the accelerator methodology meets COP's expectations for evidence-based solution design incorporating 
behavioural science and problem-solving approaches. 
• Weekly meetings with the core team at COP.
• Co-development and co-facilitation of accelerator events.
• Strong partnership working with wider national partners.

item.title: GB-London: Fit Out Works - NHS Medical Facility at Kensal Road
item.description:
The Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea has awarded a contract for the internal fit-out of a new GP medical facility located at 175-177 Kensal Road, London W10 5BJ. The works will convert a newly constructed shell and core space within the Kelso Cochrane House development into a fully operational, modern healthcare facility.
      
      The fit-out includes the installation of clinical rooms, reception and waiting areas, staff facilities, and all necessary mechanical and electrical systems to ensure the space is fully compliant and ready for occupation by a GP practice.

item.title: MSK Pathway Portal and E-Trauma
item.description:
Provision of a digital system to support the Digital Clinical Workflow for MSK Pathway & eTrauma. This is a hybrid option which subscribes to a cloud based clinical pathway management system for MSK & eTrauma.
The eTrauma element is to simplify trauma care management e.g. an end-to-end management platform, streamlined trauma handover management. The MSK element is a musculoskeletal management platform which allows community MSK service coordination.
This is an extension to the existing contract, which included a clause for an additional 12 months' extension and was subject to funding which has now been obtained and approved. The value of the contract extension is £125,000 for 12 months. Further contract extensions are not permitted.
The contract was awarded via the Crown Commercial Services G-Cloud 14 Framework and Contracts Finder Notice CF-2958300D0O000000rwimUAA dated 31st March 2025.

item.title: MOPAC: Alliance Transition Support - for the Pan-London Sexual Violence Support Service
item.description:
The Alliance Transition Support Provider will work with the Alliance Leadership Team and any other relevant partners/members who will be affected by this system change e.g. Alliance Management Team/ frontline staff/ trustees/ MOPAC management.
      4.2. This Service will provide change management support to the Alliance and equip them with skills and knowledge that will enable them to successfully transition into this system change. The key objectives of this Service are:
      • To support positive culture change within the Alliance that promotes collaboration, inclusivity, and trust.
      • To enhance partnership working across the Alliance to ensure collective action towards the development and delivery of solutions.
      • To provide leadership coaching that equips senior and emerging leaders with the tools to lead effectively during the change process.
      • To support effective dispute resolution mechanisms that mitigate conflicts and preserve the integrity of the Alliance.
      • To strengthen governance structures within the Alliance to ensure clear decision-making and accountability.
      • To facilitate a comprehensive skills and knowledge transfer process that ensures the Alliance has the capacity to continue developing solutions autonomously.
      
      The contract will commence on June 26th 2025 for a period of two years, ending 25th June 2027 with the option to extend by 1 year.

item.title: Harms Data Question Development
item.description:
This project aims to help the Office of Product Safety and Standards (OPSS) assess the feasibility of creating a concise, yet effective questionnaire for the collection of Harms Data. Harms Data encompasses information about injuries, their causes, and the resulting consequences, including both fatal and non-fatal outcomes. 

In addition to the initial 21 week term (contract end date - 06/04/26), an optional 8-week contract extension may be exercised solely at the discretion of the Buyer.
